projectPurpose: To provide a simple, easy-to-use, and efficient cross-platform game engine/library for developers using the Rust programming language, with a focus on 2D development and quick prototyping, while still offering some 3D capabilities.
mainFeatures: Cross-platform support from a single codebase
Efficient 2D rendering with automatic geometry batching
Minimal dependencies and fast compile times
Batteries-included for 2D development (audio, input, text, textures, etc.)
async/await support for cross-platform main loop

alternatives.name: Fyrox Engine
mainFeatures: Hot reloading for Rust scripts and assets

alternatives.name: Godot Engine
mainFeatures: Multiple scripting languages (GDScript, C#, C++, Rust via GDExtension)

alternatives.name: Unity
mainFeatures: Extensive tools for graphics, physics, animation, UI

alternatives.name: Unreal Engine
mainFeatures: Integrated visual editor and Blueprint visual scripting
Tools for large-scale and AAA game development

alternatives.name: Defold
mainFeatures: Lua scripting with native extension options

alternatives.name: LÖVE2D
mainFeatures: No built-in editor (uses external text editors)

marketPositioning: Macroquad positions itself as an accessible and efficient cross-platform game library for the Rust ecosystem, particularly well-suited for 2D games, rapid prototyping, and educational purposes. It differentiates itself from other Rust engines like Bevy and Fyrox by emphasizing simplicity, minimal dependencies, and fast iteration cycles, rather than a complex data-driven architecture or a full-featured visual editor. It offers a 'batteries-included' approach for core 2D development needs while remaining lightweight. Compared to established engines like Unity, Unreal Engine, and Godot, Macroquad offers a Rust-native alternative that prioritizes code-centric development and performance benefits of Rust, appealing to developers who prefer a library-like feel or want to build games without leaving the Rust environment. Its broad cross-platform support makes it a versatile choice for developers targeting desktop, web, and mobile platforms.
